Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Buforin I (natural AMPs; UCLL1; Asian toad, amphibians; pigs; human;  primates, mammals; animals;  histone-derived; BBN)
Sequence Information.Source: stomach,Bufo bufo gargarizans, Asia; Also in:Homo sapiens; Bos taurus; Sus scrofa

Literature Information.Literature: Study questions: Asian toad has been used as a wound-healing agent in traditional Korean medicine. Did AMPs help there? Also detected in bovine, porcine, and human stomach (Found in multiple species, FIMS). Its location on mucosal surfaces of vertebrate stomach plays an important role in innate defense against invading microbes.Discovery: Buforin I is produced from cytoplasmic histone H2A by the action of pepsin in the gastric gland cells of the Asian toad.Activity:  This histone-derived peptide is active against Gram+ bacteria B. subtilis, S. aureus (MIC 4 ug/ml), S. mutans (MIC 8), S. pneumoniae, P. putida (MIC 4 ug/ml), Gram- bacteria E. coli (MIC 8 ug/ml), S. typhimurium (MIC 4 ug/ml), Serratia sp. (MIC 8 ug/ml), fungi C. albicans, C. neoformans, and S. cerevisiae (MIC 4 ug/ml).SAR: Synthetic derivatives: buforin II. Updated 11/2011; 10/2016; 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Park CB, Kim MS, Kim SC.1996
Literature Information.Title: A novel antimicrobial peptide from Bufo bufo gargarizans.
